Definition at line 69 of file motion_planning.cpp.

◆ check_singularity_collision()

bool check_singularity_collision ( const double  th1,
const double  th2,
const double  th3,
const double  th4,
const double  th5,
const double  th6 
)

Give the 6 joint angles, it performs the direct kinematics for each joint, so we can know the position of alle the 6 joint,then it check that this postion is inside some defined range. In our case we have to avoid the collision with 3 plans :

  • the ceiling of our envoirment
  • the floor of our envoirment
  • the wall behind the robot
Parameters
th1
th2
th3
th4
th5
th6
Returns
true
false

◆ nearest()

JointStateVector nearest ( JointStateVector  qEs,
vector< JointStateVector >  configurations 
)

It find the closest conifguration to the starting conifguration, which furthermore fulfills two conditions :

  • the configuration must respect for each joint the limits it has
  • the configuration must not have any collision with singularities
Parameters
qEsintital joints configuration
configurationsall the 8 possible configurations , generated by the inverse kinematics
Returns
** JointStateVector

Definition at line 170 of file motion_planning.cpp.

◆ p2pMotionPlanIntermediatePoints()

vector<vector<double> > p2pMotionPlanIntermediatePoints ( const JointStateVector  qEs,
const PositionVector  xEf,
EulerVector  phiEf,
vector< PositionVector >  intermediate_points,
double  dt,
bool  turn 
)

starting from qEs configurations, calculate all the intermediate configurations (that will change every dt), draw a trajector that passes through all the intermediate points, and make reach the xEf position (with end effecor) with phiEf final configurations.

Parameters
qEsinitial joint configurations
xEffinal position that we want to reach
phiEffinal euler angles that we want to reach
intermediate_pointsvector of intermediate position that we want to cross
dttime interval between a configuration n and n+1
turnbool value that decide if this movement will end with the end effector turned
Returns
** vector<vector<double>>
